title: Bank manager loses 42L to investment fraud
author: TNN

title: Woman loses 90L in name of digital arrest
India needs stronger security measures to tackle cyber attacks: Experts
summary: Cyber security experts raise concerns over the surge in cyber attacks in India, with projections indicating up to 17 trillion attacks by 2047. PRAHAR's report highlights that in 2023 alone, India experienced over 79 million attacks, marking a 15% increase from the previous year.
author: PTI

title: Chennai student uses fake email to ‘unfreeze’ bank accounts
'Digital arrest': Senior citizen duped by online fraudsters in Mumbai, forced to pay Rs 14 lakh
summary: A 67-year-old woman from Mumbai was scammed out of Rs 14 lakh by fraudsters posing as Delhi Telecom and Cyber crime officials. They convinced her that she was involved in a money laundering case and persuaded her to transfer her savings for verification. The woman realized the fraud after consulting with her son and reported it to the police.
author: TIMESOFINDIA.COM

title: Calcutta high court live-stream hacked, investigation launched by Cyber crime department
summary: The live-stream of a Calcutta High Court vacation bench hearing was hacked, displaying an obscene video before being taken down. The incident, described as unprecedented by the IT cell, is under investigation by Kolkata Police's Cyber crime department. Previous similar incidents include a 2024 Supreme Court YouTube channel hack.
author: TNN

title: Gang of 5 rents, hires bank accounts for cyber frauds, held
Four Telangana youths pushed into Cyber crimes at ‘Chinese scam centres’
summary: Four Jagtial youths reported being deceived into cyber fraud work in Laos, promised data entry jobs by agents. They were sold to Chinese syndicates, forced into creating fake social media profiles to scam NRIs. Endured harsh conditions and abuse, they finally returned to India with assistance after a week-long ordeal.
author: TNN

title: 'Digital arrest': How a call drop ended Hyderabad techie's 24-hour ordeal
summary: A 44-year-old Hyderabad tech professional managed to escape cyber criminals' clutches after they tricked him into believing he was involved in a money laundering case. Under continuous WhatsApp video call instructions, he traveled 15 km before seeking police help early Sunday morning and avoided losing any money.
author: TNN

title: Man arrested from UP for duping Doon resident in Rs 3 cr ‘digital arrest’ scam
‘Digital arrests’: How Telangana IPS officer's tweet drew PMO's attention
summary: Prime Minister Narendra Modi highlighted a viral video of Santosh Patil from Vijayapura, Karnataka, who outwitted a cyber fraudster impersonating a police officer. The Ministry of Home Affairs, following directions from the PMO, traced Santosh for a Mann Ki Baat feature after Telangana IPS officer VC Sajjanar tweeted the video.
author: TNN

title: 2 Tirupati hotels, local temple get fresh bomb threats
summary: Tirupati police are on high alert as the city receives bomb threat emails targeting local hotels and a TTD temple. Despite extensive searches with bomb and dog squads finding no explosives, the threats have been deemed hoaxes. Investigations are intensifying.
author: TNN

title: States-centre synergy to address modern-day challenges of climate change and Cyber crimes is litmus test for our federalism model: CJI DY Chandrachud
summary: Chief Justice of India, DY Chandrachud, emphasizes the need for Centre-state cooperation to tackle global issues like climate change, AI, and cybercrimes, highlighting the transformative intent of the Constitution. He also underscores the efficiency and cooperative models of federalism, citing GST as an example.
author: TNN

title: Man cheated of Rs 31L by fake CBI officer
US returnee woman entrepreneur lodges plaint over harassment
author: TNN

title: 84-year-old cyber fraud victim gets Rs 53 lakh refund in Hyderabad
summary: Hyderabad Cyber crime police successfully refunded Rs 53 lakh to an 84-year-old victim of a Rs 2.88 crore scam. The case's prompt resolution included quickly freezing the transferred funds and securing a court order for the refund. Authorities urge citizens to report suspicious calls immediately and never send money to unknown callers, emphasizing vigilance against such frauds.
author: TNN

title: Cyber crime gang busted, 18 wanted in 320 cases held
author: TNN

title: Cyber security event for SSB
Government launches system to block ‘fake’ international scam calls: How will it make citizens safe
summary: The government has introduced the 'International Incoming Spoofed Calls Prevention System' to combat financial fraud by identifying and blocking international calls posing as Indian numbers. This system aims to reduce spoofed calls and protect citizens from scams. In the last 24 hours, it has blocked 1.35 crore spoofed calls.
author: TIMESOFINDIA.COM

title: Chennai bizman loses Rs 2 crore in email spoofing scam; here's how police recovered entire amount from fraudsters
summary: Chennai cybercrime officers successfully retrieved Rs 2 crore from US bank accounts after a businessman was scammed via spoofed emails. The email, imitating legitimate business communication, led the company general manager to make an unauthorized NEFT payment. The case underscores the importance of verifying email authenticity.=Bengaluru techie couple loses Rs 1.53 crore in trading scam
author: TNN

title: Miscreants create fake profile of top income tax officer in Hyderabad
summary: Hyderabad Cyber crime police have initiated an investigation into an unidentified individual who created a fake WhatsApp profile using the image of the principal chief commissioner of income tax, Andhra Pradesh & Telangana. The suspect has been sending messages to department officers. This is the second occurrence of such impersonation within a month.
author: TNN

title: ICICI Bank shares important details on how criminals in parcel fraud scare their targets
summary: ICICI Bank alerts customers of parcel fraud scams where criminals impersonate Customs Department or Police, claiming parcels contain illegal substances to extract personal and financial information. Victims are tricked into believing they face legal action and are coerced into sharing sensitive data. Tips include stopping and questioning unusual requests, protecting sensitive information, and reporting suspicious activities promptly.
author: TIMESOFINDIA.COM

title: Deputy bank manager among 2 held for helping cyber cons park money
iQoo India CEO has this 'email scam warning’ for everyone
summary: iQOO India's CEO, Nipun Marya, alerted users to a scam email falsely claiming to be from him, urging vigilance. He showcased a deceptive email filled with errors. This follows a July warning from the Indian Cyber crime Coordination Centre about fake government e-notices.
author: TIMESOFINDIA.COM

title: Two arrested for duping traders on pretext of fixing UPI sound box
